title: Starmer pledges £1.6 billion package for air defense missiles in Ukraine, says Europe is 'at crossroads in history'
summary: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said Europe is 'at a crossroads in history' and pledged 5,000 air defense missiles for Ukraine after a summit in London with leaders from Europe, Canada and Turkey.

title: Ukraine summit 'once in a generation' moment for European security, says Starmer
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky joined leaders from Europe, Turkey and Canada in London on Sunday for a summit on the war in Ukraine and European security hosted by UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer.

title: Zelensky says Ukraine 'ready' to sign minerals deal with US
summary: After the Ukrainian leader's heated exchange on Friday with President Donald Trump at the White House, Zelensky drove off in his motorcade shortly after being asked to leave, without holding a planned joint press conference. The resources deal, which was one of Zelensky's reasons for heading to Washington, was left unsigned.

title: 'Donald Trump and Elon Musk are plunging American science into indescribable chaos'
summary: By cutting tens of thousands of jobs and slashing funding for research they accuse of 'wokism,' the US president and the billionaire are waging an unprecedented attack on the production of knowledge, writes Le Monde columnist Stéphane Foucart.

title: Israel blocks entry of humanitarian supplies into Gaza
summary: All humanitarian aid to Gaza was cut off by Israel on Sunday, warning of 'other consequences' if Hamas did not agree to the second phase of a ceasefire plan put forward by the US.

title: Oscars 2025: Hollywood's glitziest night begins as 'Anora,' 'Conclave' vie for top prize
summary: The race for best picture at the 2025 edition of cinema's most prestigious awards ceremony, hosted by Conan O'Brien, has proven too close to call for many critics and voters.

title: Pope Francis in stable condition and now off ventilation, signaling he's overcome risks from respiratory crisis
summary: Pope Francis was hospitalized on February 14 with bronchitis that soon developed into double pneumonia.

title: Fighting in the DRC sparks a surge of sexual violence
summary: UNICEF recorded nearly 600 cases of rape in the week following the fall of Goma, in the east of the country, at the end of January. All sides in the conflict are implicated in these crimes, from the Rwandan-backed M23 rebels to Congolese forces.

title: 'Trump's first weeks as president have been enough to give the nightmare of America's turn to fascism a feeling of reality'
summary: Until the billionaire's re-election, it was unthinkable to associate the word 'fascism' with the 'US'. Le Monde columnist Philippe Bernard looks back on Germany in the 1930s to understand why what is underway in Washington is full of lessons.

title: Nations fail to break deadlock on UN climate report timing
summary: Nations were deciding whether the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change would deliver its next assessment before 2028.

title: Russian propaganda video supporting US-led ceasefire in Ukraine tries to change minds of pro-war supporters
summary: Widely distributed on Russian Telegram channels, a government-produced video is justifying an end to the fighting with Kyiv, to the chagrin of some Russian pro-war bloggers.

title: Germany's CDU and SPD begin government coalition talks
summary: Despite declarations by Friedrich Merz, the likely future chancellor, the future government's road to taking office looks to be long and strewn with pitfalls.

title: Brits embrace 'Brat' as Charli XCX wins big at UK pop music awards
summary: Charli XCX's club pop hit album 'Brat' was celebrated at the Brits on Saturday night after her massive summer.

title: US spaceship lands upright on Moon in a first for a private mission
summary: A US company successfully landed its spacecraft on the Moon on March 2, 2025, making it only the second private lander to achieve this milestone, a live webcast from mission control showed.

title: Ukrainians angry, in shock after heated Trump-Zelensky White House meeting
summary: Ukrainians backed their President Zelensky after the disastrous exchange, but the country's opposition could take advantage of his failed trip to Washington.

title: Europe, shocked by explosive Trump-Zelensky White House row, prepares for a decisive summit
summary: Emmanuel Macron, Donald Tusk, Olaf Scholz, Keir Starmer and Ursula von der Leyen immediately threw their support behind the Ukrainian president. They will meet on Sunday, March 2, in London for a summit on Ukraine organized by Starmer.

title: Manufacturers' campaign to encourage yogurt pot recycling has more than meets the eye
summary: Dairy manufacturers are launching a major marketing campaign on sorting yogurt pots, which are harder to recycle than most consumers think due to a highly resistant chemical used to make them: polystyrene.

title: Trump-Zelensky row, seen from Russia: Pro-Putin media amused by Trump's scolding of 'clown' Zelensky
summary: Former president Dmitry Medvedev set the tone for Russian reactions, both scornful and triumphant, after the heated exchanges at the White House between Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelensky.

title: Cinema attendance was modest in 2024, but a more hopeful 2025 lies ahead
summary: Affected by a shortage of Hollywood movies, the world's leading market, the US, declined slightly last year, while China slumped due to a lack of strong domestic films. Europe remained stable.

title: Patrick Artus: 'France is essentially suffering from low production levels'
summary: The economist warns in his column that a public deficit reduction strategy based solely on tax hikes and spending cuts, and which fails to tackle the causes of low GDP levels, would be ineffective.

title: 'The New Yorker' in 'Le Monde,' admiration tinged with respect for a centenarian
summary: The American weekly celebrated its 100th anniversary in February. The French newspaper, which first mentioned it on March 2, 1945, has regularly covered the magazine, praising its literary and journalistic qualities.

title: Egypt's double game in Gaza
summary: Jean-Pierre Filiu writes in his column that the Egyptian regime is perhaps reaping too many benefits from the prolonged conflict in Gaza to make a meaningful contribution to ending it.
